article.headline: Baylor 89, Texas St. 64
article.story: WACO, Texas (AP) -- Kevin Rogers scored 18 points, Curtis Jerrells had 17 and Henry Dugat added 15 to help Baylor beat Texas State 89-64 Saturday. The Bears (6-1) have won four straight are off to their best start since 2002. Dylan Moseley hit four 3-pointers and led Texas State (2-5) with 12 points. Baylor started the game on a 20-5 run and ended the first half up 45-28. The Bobcats opened the second half on a 19-9 run to cut the deficit to seven, but Baylor quickly pulled away. The Bears shot nearly 57 percent from the field had five players in double figures. Aaron Bruce scored 11 points and Tim Bush had 10 off the bench. Baylor's Mamadou Diene led all rebounders with 10 and had four blocks. Charles Dotson added 10 points for the Bobcats.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
